availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James G. Dick (First Kentucky Cavalry Regiment.)

body.p: Wayne County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Farmer in Wayne County in 1860. Second lieutenant and captain in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from September 1, 1861 to December 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 28-29.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, p. 109.
Find A Grave, "Capt James G. Dick (August 23, 1829-December 3, 1894)," Memorial #62741470, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/62741470 (accessed October 10, 2018).
